name: Full Night Flight Chicago to Louisville (EMB 145)
description:
Welcome!  This is the fifth and final video in a series relating to my trip to Denver with my wife Beth.  After enjoying a trip for our anniversary, it was time to head home to Louisville. 

This video covers the full flight of our final leg home from Chicago O'Hare International Airport to my home, Louisville International Airport.  After a long taxi that featured a bit of planespotting around the airfield, we had a swift takeoff to the southwest turning south.  We had a quiet, smooth flight with the full moon beside us and a timely landing at Louisville's shorter runway, 17L, after crossing the Ohio River.  

I did a complete, nine-concourse photo tour of Chicago O'Hare following a Windy City walk last March; read about it here!
http://www.milesbyfoot.com/2015/05/walking-windy-city-part-8.html

Thanks again for watching, and enjoy!

Flight Information
Airline: United Airlines
Flight Number: UA2027
Date of Flight: Sunday, November 1st, 2015

Origin Airport: Chicago O'Hare International Airport (KORD/ORD)
Destination Airport: Louisville International Airport (KSDF/SDF)

Departing Gate: B18
Scheduled Departure: 21:03 CST
Actual Departure from Gate: 21:02 CST
Takeoff Runway and Time: RWY 22L / 21:16 CST
Landing Runway and Time: RWY 17L / 23:02 EST
Scheduled Arrival: 23:20 EST
Actual Arrival at Gate: 23:11 EST
Arriving Gate: A14

Aircraft Information
Type: Embrear 145XR
Registration: N11113
Aircraft Delivery: November 2002
Engines: 2x AN AE3007A1E
Seats: 8C & 8D

Video Highlights and Timeline
01:40 - Taxi
04:00 - Takeoff
07:00 - Descending over the Ohio River
10:15 - Landing

Technical Specs
Camera: Nikon D3200 with 18-55mm lenses

A big thanks to my wife Beth as my cameraperson throughout the journey, and particularly for this segment!

This video is the sole property of www.milesbyfoot.com.  Any unauthorized use of the video or audio content from this video is prohibited.  If you'd like to use any portion of this video, please e-mail me at milesbyfoot@gmail.com and I'll be happy work with you!
